clusters.title: At least four dead and several injured in shooting at Mormon church in Michigan
clusters.neutral_headline: Michigan church shooting leaves multiple dead, several injured

items.title: At least four dead and several injured in shooting at Mormon church in Michigan
items.standfirst: Police say "hundreds" of people were attending Sunday service when the attacker drove a vehicle into the church and opened fire.
items.content: Police say "hundreds" of people were attending Sunday service when the attacker drove a vehicle into the church and opened fire.

items.title: Police: At least 4 killed, 8 hurt in attack at Michigan church; suspect dead
items.standfirst: At least four people are dead after a shooter opened fire at a church in Michigan during a Sunday morning worship service and then set it ablaze. Eight other victims have been hospitalized, according to police.
items.content: At least four people are dead after a shooter opened fire at a church in Michigan during a Sunday morning worship service and then set it ablaze. Eight other victims have been hospitalized, according to police.

items.title: Latest details on Michigan LDS church shooting that killed at least 4
items.standfirst: At least four people were killed Sunday when a gunman rammed his truck into a Michigan church and opened fire during worship services. CBS News' Terell Bailey has more.
items.content: At least four people were killed Sunday when a gunman rammed his truck into a Michigan church and opened fire during worship services. CBS News' Terell Bailey has more.

items.title: Here's what we know about the suspect in the Michigan church shooting
items.standfirst: Police in Grand Blanc, Michigan, say the man suspected of killing at least four people and injuring eight others at a church on Sunday morning died after "exchanging gunfire" with police.
items.content: Police in Grand Blanc, Michigan, say the man suspected of killing at least four people and injuring eight others at a church on Sunday morning died after "exchanging gunfire" with police.

items.title: At least four dead and eight injured after shooting at Mormon church in Michigan
items.standfirst: Church allegedly set ablaze by gunman on weekend when shooting attacks also took place in North Carolina, Texas and New OrleansAt least four people were killed and eight others injured after a gunman opened fire at a Mormon church in Michigan and then set the building ablaze, authorities said.Two of the shooting victims died and eight others were hospitalised, officials said initially, while the gunman was shot dead by police. Several hours after the shooting, police reported finding at least two more bodies in the charred remains of the church, which had not yet been cleared and may contain other victims. Continue reading...

Several hours after the shooting, police reported finding at least two more bodies in the charred remains of the church, which had not yet been cleared and may contain other victims. Continue reading...

The investigation into the shooting at the Church of Jesus…
items.content: Michigan officials say additional bodies were discovered in the church, raising the total to four fatal victims, plus the suspect, Thomas Jacob Sanford, as the fifth deceased, according to Grand Blanc Township Police Chief William Renye. items.title: 3 dead, at least 5 injured in shooting at North Carolina waterfront bar
items.standfirst: From a boat sailing past one of Southport's waterfront bars, a shooter opened fire into a crowd of patrons and fled. Authorities said they quickly arrested a person of interest.
items.content: From a boat sailing past one of Southport's waterfront bars, a shooter opened fire into a crowd of patrons and fled. Authorities said they quickly arrested a person of interest.

items.title: 2 dead, 8 injured in deadly Michigan church attack
items.standfirst: Police say two people were killed and eight more were injured after a 40-year-old suspect opened fire at the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints in Great Blanc, Michigan. NBC News’ Adrienne Broaddus and Tom Winter have the latest on the investigation.
items.content: Police say two people were killed and eight more were injured after a 40-year-old suspect opened fire at the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints in Great Blanc, Michigan. NBC News’ Adrienne Broaddus and Tom Winter have the latest on the investigation.

items.title: At least 2 killed in Michigan LDS church shooting
items.standfirst: At least two people were killed and eight others were injured when a gunman opened fire at a Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Michigan during a Sunday morning service. Shanelle Kaul has more.
items.content: At least two people were killed and eight others were injured when a gunman opened fire at a Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Michigan during a Sunday morning service. Shanelle Kaul has more.

items.title: A list of notable shooting attacks on houses of worship in the U.S. in the past 20 years

It was the latest of many shooting attacks on houses of worship in the U.S. over the…

items.title: Suspect held after allegedly firing from boat into waterfront bar in North Carolina
items.standfirst: The attack took place at the American Fish Company, a bar and live music venue. Police are asking anyone who witnessed the shooting to contact them.
items.content: The attack took place at the American Fish Company, a bar and live music venue. Police are asking anyone who witnessed the shooting to contact them.(Image credit: Chris Seward)

items.title: At least four dead in shooting and fire at Mormon church in Michigan
items.standfirst: A lone gunman opened fire inside a Mormon church in the US state of Michigan during Sunday services before the building was set on fire. At least four people were killed and several injured before the police shot the gunman.
items.content: A lone gunman opened fire inside a Mormon church in the US state of Michigan during Sunday services before the building was set on fire. At least four people were killed and several injured before the police shot the gunman.

items.title: US shooter kills at least four at Mormon church in Michigan
items.standfirst: At least eight others injured in shooting and fire in Grand Blanc Township, and suspect shot dead by police.
items.content: At least eight others injured in shooting and fire in Grand Blanc Township, and suspect shot dead by police.

items.title: Attack at a Mormon church in Michigan leaves at least 4 dead, 8 injured
items.standfirst: Multiple people were shot at a Mormon church in Michigan that was then set on fire, authorities said Sunday. The shooter was killed by police.
items.content: Multiple people were shot at a Mormon church in Michigan that was then set on fire, authorities said Sunday. The shooter was killed by police.(Image credit: Carlos Osorio)

items.title: Three dead and several injured after shooting at US waterfront bar
items.standfirst: The attacker opened fire from a boat at a crowded waterfront bar in Southport, North Carolina, officials say.
items.content: The attacker opened fire from a boat at a crowded waterfront bar in Southport, North Carolina, officials say.

ai_summary: A gunman opened fire at a Michigan church during a Sunday worship service, causing fatalities.
Authorities reported at least four deaths and eight injuries from the church shooting incident.
The suspect in the Michigan church shooting died after exchanging gunfire with police.
Additional bodies were found in the church, raising the total confirmed fatalities.
The church was allegedly set ablaze by the gunman after the shooting occurred.

clusters.title: Russian drone, missile attack on Kyiv kills at least 4
clusters.neutral_headline: Russian attacks on Kyiv kill at least four people

items.title: Russian drone, missile attack on Kyiv kills at least 4
items.standfirst: This is the first major bombardment since an air attack in August on Kyiv left at least 21 people dead.
items.content: This is the first major bombardment since an air attack in August on Kyiv left at least 21 people dead.

items.title: 4 people killed, dozens injured in major Russian attack on Ukraine's capital
items.standfirst: Russia launched hundreds of drones and missiles at Ukraine's capital, Kyiv, overnight. Four people were killed and dozens were injured in what was one of the most sustained attacks since Moscow's invasion. Leigh Kiniry has more on the impact.
items.content: Russia launched hundreds of drones and missiles at Ukraine's capital, Kyiv, overnight. Four people were killed and dozens were injured in what was one of the most sustained attacks since Moscow's invasion. Leigh Kiniry has more on the impact.

items.title: Zelenskyy condemns Russia’s ‘vile and cowardly’ 12-hour bombing of Ukraine
items.standfirst: Moscow targets Kyiv and other regions with about 600 drones and 40 missiles, killing at least four peopleOne of the worst bombardments of Kyiv since the start of Vladimir Putin’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine has killed at least four people in what Volodymyr Zelenskyy described as a “vile and cowardly” attack.Russia launched nearly 600 drones and more than 40 cruise missiles in a bombardment that lasted more than 12 hours over Saturday night and into Sunday morning. The main targets were the Ukrainian capital and the regions of Zaporizhzhia, Khmelnytskyi, Sumy, Mykolaiv, Chernihiv and Odesa. Continue reading...
items.content: Moscow targets Kyiv and other regions with about 600 drones and 40 missiles, killing at least four peopleOne of the worst bombardments of Kyiv since the start of Vladimir Putin’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine has killed at least four people in what Volodymyr Zelenskyy described as a “vile and cowardly” attack.Russia launched nearly 600 drones and more than 40 cruise missiles in a bombardment that lasted more than 12 hours over Saturday night and into Sunday morning. The main targets were the Ukrainian capital and the regions of Zaporizhzhia, Khmelnytskyi, Sumy, Mykolaiv, Chernihiv and Odesa. Continue reading...

items.title: Ukraine: Massive Russian missile and drone barrage kills at least four in Kyiv
items.standfirst: Russia pounded Ukraine for hours with hundreds of drones and missiles overnight, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, Kyiv said Sunday. Story by Axelle Simon and Olivia Bizot.
items.content: Russia pounded Ukraine for hours with hundreds of drones and missiles overnight, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, Kyiv said Sunday. Story by Axelle Simon and Olivia Bizot.

items.title: Heavy Russian drone attack kills at least four in Ukraine’s capital Kyiv
items.standfirst: Russia has launched a heavy attack on Ukraine with hundreds of kamikaze drones hitting residential buildings in Kyiv.
items.content: Russia has launched a heavy attack on Ukraine with hundreds of kamikaze drones hitting residential buildings in Kyiv.

items.title: 'Hundreds' of drones and missiles fired at Ukraine by Russia
items.standfirst: At least four people have been killed in Kyiv following a Russian aerial bombardment across Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelensky said.
items.content: At least four people have been killed in Kyiv following a Russian aerial bombardment across Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelensky said.

items.title: Ukraine: Kyiv hit by massive Russian drone and missile attack
items.standfirst: Russia launched hundreds of drones and missiles at Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine early on Sunday, killing at least four people and injuring dozens, in one of the most sustained attacks on the capital since the full-scale war began. Story by FRANCE 24's Kyiv correspondent Aidan Stretch.
items.content: Russia launched hundreds of drones and missiles at Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine early on Sunday, killing at least four people and injuring dozens, in one of the most sustained attacks on the capital since the full-scale war began. Story by FRANCE 24's Kyiv correspondent Aidan Stretch.

items.title: Russian missiles and drones pound Ukraine in ‘savage’ 12-hour attack
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says assault involved nearly 500 drones and more than 40 missiles
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says assault involved nearly 500 drones and more than 40 missiles

items.title: Russia launches deadly aerial attack on Ukraine as Poland scrambles jets
items.standfirst: Russia launched a massive aerial assault on Ukraine’s capital and across the country early Sunday, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, the Ukrainian government said.
items.content: Russia launched a massive aerial assault on Ukraine’s capital and across the country early Sunday, killing at least four people, including a 12-year-old girl, the Ukrainian government said.

ai_summary: Russia launched a major drone and missile attack on Kyiv, Ukraine's capital city.
The attack on Kyiv resulted in at least four fatalities and dozens of injuries.
The bombardment lasted over twelve hours, targeting Kyiv and surrounding regions.
The attack involved hundreds of drones and over forty cruise missiles fired by Russia.
The attack was described as one of the worst since the start of the invasion.

clusters.title: Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayor's race
clusters.neutral_headline: New York City Mayor Eric Adams drops reelection bid

items.title: Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayor's race
items.standfirst: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is dropping his bid for reelection, setting up a three-way race between Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa.
items.content: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is dropping his bid for reelection, setting up a three-way race between Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa.

items.title: New Yorkers 'will not be bought': Zohran Mamdani on Eric Adams dropping out of NYC mayoral race
items.standfirst: NYC Mayor Eric Adams has suspended his re-election bid, becoming the first one-term mayor since David Dinkins in 1993.
items.content: NYC Mayor Eric Adams has suspended his re-election bid, becoming the first one-term mayor since David Dinkins in 1993.

items.title: Pro-crypto NYC Mayor Eric Adams drops out of reelection race, citing finance woes
items.standfirst: Adams declined to endorse any of his three opponents, Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo, and Curtis Sliwa.
items.content: Adams declined to endorse any of his three opponents, Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo, and Curtis Sliwa.

items.title: New York Mayor Eric Adams abandons reelection campaign
items.standfirst: New York Mayor Eric Adams said Sunday he would drop his reelection bid after losing ground to Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani, a self-described socialist. Adams, 65, once popular, was weakened by corruption probes and criticism over his cooperation with Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown.
items.content: New York Mayor Eric Adams said Sunday he would drop his reelection bid after losing ground to Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani, a self-described socialist. Adams, 65, once popular, was weakened by corruption probes and criticism over his cooperation with Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown.

items.title: New York mayor Eric Adams abandons re-election bid
items.standfirst: Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani and Andrew Cuomo will now face off in city’s November poll
items.content: Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani and Andrew Cuomo will now face off in city’s November poll

items.title: Eric Adams drops out of New York City mayoral race
items.standfirst: New York City mayor abandons faltering bid to win re-election in social media video set to strains of song My WayThe mayor of New York City, Eric Adams, announced on Sunday that he is abandoning his faltering bid to win re-election, just over a month before election day, delivering the message in a social media video set to the strains of My Way.Adams, who was trailing in the polls, was elected as a Democrat but ran for re-election as an independent after he was indicted on federal corruption charges, which were then dropped by the Trump administration in exchange for his cooperation on immigration raids. Continue reading...
items.content: New York City mayor abandons faltering bid to win re-election in social media video set to strains of song My WayThe mayor of New York City, Eric Adams, announced on Sunday that he is abandoning his faltering bid to win re-election, just over a month before election day, delivering the message in a social media video set to the strains of My Way.Adams, who was trailing in the polls, was elected as a Democrat but ran for re-election as an independent after he was indicted on federal corruption charges, which were then dropped by the Trump administration in exchange for his cooperation on immigration raids. Continue reading...

items.title: Eric Adams says he is dropping out of New York City mayoral race
items.standfirst: Adams bows out, leaving the race between Democrat Zohran Mamdani and former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo.
items.content: Adams bows out, leaving the race between Democrat Zohran Mamdani and former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo.

ai_summary: New York City Mayor Eric Adams announced he would not seek reelection.
Adams' decision sets up a three-way race for the New York City mayoralty.
Adams cited financial woes as a reason for dropping his reelection bid.
Adams was trailing in polls and faced criticism during his term.
Adams did not endorse any of his three opponents in the upcoming election.

clusters.title: Humberto strengthens to major hurricane in the Atlantic
clusters.neutral_headline: Tropical Storm Imelda forms, Hurricane Humberto remains strong

items.title: Humberto strengthens to major hurricane in the Atlantic
items.standfirst: Humberto rapidly strengthened, even reaching Category 5 status for a period of time as it churned over the Atlantic Ocean, the National Hurricane Center said.
items.content: Humberto rapidly strengthened, even reaching Category 5 status for a period of time as it churned over the Atlantic Ocean, the National Hurricane Center said.

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda threatens Southeast, expected to strengthen
items.standfirst: Imelda is the ninth named storm of the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season, and it could bring heavy rain to the U.S. coast from Florida to the Carolinas.
items.content: Imelda is the ninth named storm of the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season, and it could bring heavy rain to the U.S. coast from Florida to the Carolinas.

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda forms, expected to threaten Carolinas with heavy rains
items.standfirst: Tropical Storm Imelda formed Sunday, joining the monster Hurricane Humberto in the Atlantic, and forecasters warned it'll likely bring heavy rains to the Carolinas. The big picture: Imelda is expected to strengthen over the Bahamas on Monday and become a major hurricane that night or early…
items.content: Tropical Storm Imelda formed Sunday, joining the monster Hurricane Humberto in the Atlantic, and forecasters warned it'll likely bring heavy rains to the Carolinas. The big picture: Imelda is expected to strengthen over the Bahamas on Monday and become a major hurricane that night or early…

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda forming and expected to become hurricane
items.standfirst: Forecast track could take storm, which caused disruption in Bahamas and Cuba, away from US east coastTropical Storm Imelda formed on Sunday and was expected to become a hurricane on a forecast track that could take it away from the US east coast in the coming days. The storm was causing disruption in the Bahamas and Cuba on Sunday, and a tropical storm watch was posted in parts of Florida.Meanwhile, Hurricane Humberto weakened very slightly but remained a strong category 4 storm in the Atlantic, threatening Bermuda. Continue reading...
items.content: Forecast track could take storm, which caused disruption in Bahamas and Cuba, away from US east coastTropical Storm Imelda formed on Sunday and was expected to become a hurricane on a forecast track that could take it away from the US east coast in the coming days. The storm was causing disruption in the Bahamas and Cuba on Sunday, and a tropical storm watch was posted in parts of Florida.Meanwhile, Hurricane Humberto weakened very slightly but remained a strong category 4 storm in the Atlantic, threatening Bermuda. Continue reading...

items.title: Tropical depression forms near Bahamas as Hurricane Humberto rips through the Atlantic
items.standfirst: The National Hurricane Center said Saturday that a disturbance near the Bahamas has strengthened into Tropical Depression Nine and is expected to intensify into a tropical storm later in the evening, possibly reaching hurricane strength by early next week.
items.content: The National Hurricane Center said Saturday that a disturbance near the Bahamas has strengthened into Tropical Depression Nine and is expected to intensify into a tropical storm later in the evening, possibly reaching hurricane strength by early next week.

ai_summary: Tropical Storm Imelda formed in the Atlantic, joining Hurricane Humberto.
Imelda is expected to bring heavy rains to the Carolinas, according to forecasts.
Hurricane Humberto remains a strong Category 4 storm in the Atlantic Ocean.
Imelda is expected to strengthen and potentially become a hurricane.
A tropical storm watch was posted in parts of Florida due to Imelda.

clusters.title: Oregon sues Trump administration over deployment of National Guard troops to Portland

items.title: Oregon sues Trump administration over deployment of National Guard troops to Portland

items.content: Democratic Oregon Gov. Tina Kotek speaks at a news conference in Portland, Ore., on Saturday, Sept. 27, 2025, after Republican President Donald Trump said he would send troops to the city.

items.title: Oregon sues Trump administration over plans to send troops to Portland
items.standfirst: State Attorney General Dan Rayfield said Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth sent a memo to Gov. Tina Kotek authorizing 200 members of the Oregon National Guard to the city of Portland.
items.content: State Attorney General Dan Rayfield said Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth sent a memo to Gov. Tina Kotek authorizing 200 members of the Oregon National Guard to the city of Portland.

items.title: Oregon sues Trump administration over deployment of US military to Portland
items.standfirst: Oregon sued on Sunday to block President Donald Trump’s order to deploy US troops to Portland, a day after the directive was issued. The move mirrors earlier deployments to Los Angeles and Washington, DC, opposed by local Democratic leaders, highlighting tensions over federal intervention in cities.
items.content: Oregon sued on Sunday to block President Donald Trump’s order to deploy US troops to Portland, a day after the directive was issued. The move mirrors earlier deployments to Los Angeles and Washington, DC, opposed by local Democratic leaders, highlighting tensions over federal intervention in cities.

items.standfirst: Oregon Attorney General Dan Rayfield has filed a lawsuit seeking to block the Trump administration from deploying troops to Portland. items.title: Oregon sues Trump in bid to stop National Guard deployment to Portland
items.standfirst: Oregon and Portland are suing President Trump in an effort to block his move to deploy federal troops to the state's largest city. The big picture: The lawsuit that was filed in the U.S. District Court in Portland, Ore., on Sunday noted that following Trump's directive, Defense Secretary Pete…

The big picture: The lawsuit that was filed in the U.S. District Court in Portland, Ore., on Sunday noted that following Trump's directive, Defense Secretary Pete…

items.title: Oregon sues to block ‘illegal’ deployment of 200 national guard troops to Portland
items.standfirst: State attorney general asks federal court to block Trump from sending troops to city based on ‘social media gossip’The state of Oregon filed a lawsuit in federal court on Sunday seeking to block the deployment of 200 national guard troops to Portland, arguing Donald Trump’s characterization of the peaceful city as “war ravaged” is “pure fiction”.Oregon’s governor, Tina Kotek, said at a news conference that she had been notified by the Pentagon that the US president had seized control of the state’s reservists, claiming authority granted to him to suppress “rebellion” or lawlessness. Continue reading...
items.content: State attorney general asks federal court to block Trump from sending troops to city based on ‘social media gossip’The state of Oregon filed a lawsuit in federal court on Sunday seeking to block the deployment of 200 national guard troops to Portland, arguing Donald Trump’s characterization of the peaceful city as “war ravaged” is “pure fiction”.Oregon’s governor, Tina Kotek, said at a news conference that she had been notified by the Pentagon that the US president had seized control of the state’s reservists, claiming authority granted to him to suppress “rebellion” or lawlessness. Continue reading...

items.title: Oregon Sues Trump Administration Over National Guard Deployment

ai_summary: Oregon is suing the Trump administration to block troop deployment to Portland.
The lawsuit challenges President Trump's order to send troops to Portland.
The state's attorney general filed the lawsuit in federal court.
The deployment of troops mirrors previous actions in other cities.
The lawsuit aims to prevent the deployment of 200 National Guard troops.

clusters.title: US citizen Amir Amiry freed by Taliban in Afghanistan
clusters.neutral_headline: US citizen Amir Amiry freed by Taliban in Afghanistan

items.title: US citizen Amir Amiry freed by Taliban in Afghanistan
items.standfirst: Secretary of state Marco Rubio welcomes release as ‘important step forward’ as Taliban seek to normalise relations with USThe Taliban on Sunday freed a US citizen from an Afghan prison, weeks after they said they had reached an agreement with US envoys on a prisoner exchange as part of an effort to normalise relations.US secretary of state Marco Rubio welcomed the release of Amir Amiry, saying it marked the administration’s determination, reinforced by Donald Trump’s recent executive order, to protect American nationals from wrongful detention abroad. Continue reading...
items.content: Secretary of state Marco Rubio welcomes release as ‘important step forward’ as Taliban seek to normalise relations with USThe Taliban on Sunday freed a US citizen from an Afghan prison, weeks after they said they had reached an agreement with US envoys on a prisoner exchange as part of an effort to normalise relations.US secretary of state Marco Rubio welcomed the release of Amir Amiry, saying it marked the administration’s determination, reinforced by Donald Trump’s recent executive order, to protect American nationals from wrongful detention abroad. Continue reading...

items.title: US citizen released by Taliban after nine-month detention
items.standfirst: Amir Amiry is expected to return to the US after months of negotiations for his release, which were led by Qatari mediators.
items.content: Amir Amiry is expected to return to the US after months of negotiations for his release, which were led by Qatari mediators.

items.title: Taliban releases US citizen Amir Amiri after Qatari mediation
items.standfirst: Amiri is the fifth US citizen held by the Taliban government in Afghanistan to be freed this year.
items.content: Amiri is the fifth US citizen held by the Taliban government in Afghanistan to be freed this year.

items.title: American citizen released by Taliban 9 months after arrest in Afghanistan
items.standfirst: An American citizen held by the Taliban since December 2024 has been released from Afghanistan, Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced Sunday.
items.content: An American citizen held by the Taliban since December 2024 has been released from Afghanistan, Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced Sunday.

ai_summary: The Taliban released US citizen Amir Amiry from an Afghan prison.
The release followed months of negotiations for Amiry's freedom.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio welcomed the release of the US citizen.
Amiry's release is seen as a step toward normalizing relations.
Amiry was held by the Taliban since December 2024.

clusters.title: Pro-EU party in Moldova wins election mired in claims of Russian interference
clusters.neutral_headline: Pro-EU party wins Moldova election amid Russian interference claims

items.title: Pro-EU party in Moldova wins election mired in claims of Russian interference
items.standfirst: The vote was seen as critical for Moldova's EU path, and President Maia Sandu warned the country's future was in danger.
items.content: The vote was seen as critical for Moldova's EU path, and President Maia Sandu warned the country's future was in danger.

items.title: Moldova’s pro-EU party leads polls in election fraught with Russian interference claims
items.standfirst: Moldova’s pro-Western ruling party appears on track to top polls in a critical parliamentary election that was overshadowed by Russian interference claims. But it isn’t yet clear whether the party will secure a majority.
items.content: Moldova’s pro-Western ruling party appears on track to top polls in a critical parliamentary election that was overshadowed by Russian interference claims. But it isn’t yet clear whether the party will secure a majority.

items.title: Moldova’s pro-EU party wins pivotal election mired in claims of Russian meddling
items.standfirst: Moldova's ruling PAS party pulled comfortably ahead of its Russian-leaning rivals in a high-stakes parliamentary election as final results trickled in on Monday, leaving the EU candidate country that borders Ukraine on a path towards European integration. The tense vote was marked by a string of incidents and overshadowed by accusations of Russian interference.
items.content: Moldova's ruling PAS party pulled comfortably ahead of its Russian-leaning rivals in a high-stakes parliamentary election as final results trickled in on Monday, leaving the EU candidate country that borders Ukraine on a path towards European integration. The tense vote was marked by a string of incidents and overshadowed by accusations of Russian interference.

items.title: Moldova’s pro-EU party takes lead in election as vote counting under way
items.standfirst: Moldovans await the results of a closely-watched parliamentary election, amid claims of Russian interference.
items.content: Moldovans await the results of a closely-watched parliamentary election, amid claims of Russian interference.

items.title: Moldova: bomb threats in polling stations abroad amid tense election
items.standfirst: Moldovans on Sunday cast ballots in a tense parliamentary election plagued by claims of Russian interference, a vote seen as a choice between integration with the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold. The election was clouded by security incidents, including in polling stations abroad. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent Maria Gerth-Niculescu and analysis by the Romania editor of Radio France International (RFI), Ovidiu Nahol.
items.content: Moldovans on Sunday cast ballots in a tense parliamentary election plagued by claims of Russian interference, a vote seen as a choice between integration with the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold. The election was clouded by security incidents, including in polling stations abroad. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent Maria Gerth-Niculescu and analysis by the Romania editor of Radio France International (RFI), Ovidiu Nahol.

items.title: Moldovans vote in a tense election plagued by Russian interference claims
items.standfirst: Moldovans on Sunday cast ballots in a tense parliamentary election plagued by claims of Russian interference, a vote seen as a choice between integration with the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold. Analysis by FRANCE 24 international affaires editor Philip Turle.
items.content: Moldovans on Sunday cast ballots in a tense parliamentary election plagued by claims of Russian interference, a vote seen as a choice between integration with the European Union or a drift back into Moscow’s fold. Analysis by FRANCE 24 international affaires editor Philip Turle.

items.title: False bomb threats, security incidents cloud Moldova’s parliamentary vote
items.standfirst: Reporting from the Moldovan capital Chisinau, FRANCE 24’s Maria Gerth-Niculescu says there have been several security incidents on election day. False bomb threats briefly halted overseas voting in several EU cities on Sunday, according to Moldova’s foreign ministry, and cyberattacks targeted some official sites as the country voted in a tense parliamentary election.
items.content: Reporting from the Moldovan capital Chisinau, FRANCE 24’s Maria Gerth-Niculescu says there have been several security incidents on election day. False bomb threats briefly halted overseas voting in several EU cities on Sunday, according to Moldova’s foreign ministry, and cyberattacks targeted some official sites as the country voted in a tense parliamentary election.

items.title: Moldovans choose between pro-EU and pro-Russia camps in tense election
